newsitem.title: USA: Tobacco cos have no comment on Clinton criticism.
newsitem.headline: Tobacco cos have no comment on Clinton criticism.

text.p: U.S. tobacco companies had no immediate comment on President Clinton's criticism of certian elements of the proposed tobacco settlement.
Speaking in Madrid, where he is attending a meeting of NATO leaders, Clinton said the pact would impose "unreasonable" limits on Food and Drug Administration regulation of tobacco products.
Clinton said the portion of the plan covering the FDA should be changed. He said he did not believe the tobacco companies would scuttle the deal over the change he favors.

A spokesman at Bozell Sawyer Miller Group, which represents the tobacco companies, said there would be no comment until a report on the tobacco accord had been issued this afternoon by former U.S. Surgeon General C. Everett Koop and former FDA Commissioner David Kessler.
Shares of U.S. tobacco stocks were broadly lower after Clinton's comments.
Philip Morris Cos Inc, maker of Marlboro, fell 15/16 to 43-1/2.
RJR Nabisco Holdings Corp, which owns R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Co, dropped 1/2 to 32-1/4.
The ADRs of B.A.T Industries Plc, which owns Brown & Williamson Tobacco, were off 7/16 to 18-1/2.
UST Inc, whose United States Tobacco Co is the largest U.S. seller of smokeless tobacco, shed 5/8 to 27-7/8.
Loews Corp, which includes Lorillard Tobacco Co, dropped 1-3/16 to 102.
Gallaher Group Plc, a spinoff from American Brands and the largest seller of cigarettes in the UK, was off 1/16 to 17-15/16.
Brooke Group Ltd, which owns Liggett Group Inc, was unchanged at 3-3/8.
